I dont know if it's a stupid question but I'm a newbie in the field of speech...I was reading many papers about Arabic pronuncation checking and I've found that all of them follow the same steps : audio file processing, feature extraction by MFCC.. trainning and testing by HMM.
the question is that if I have training audio files and extracted MFCC features why do I need Language model and linguist and acoustic model for trainning? I thought that these models are used in Speech recognition to detect the most likely word but what it will benifit me if my goal is only to check for pronounciation?

I am making something like a search button for a website. the website is in Arabic so the search queries are all in Arabic. I want to make the queries work even if the searching string(title) wasn't identical to the searched one but had big similarity. like Ø§Ø¨Ø¹Ø§Ø¯ Ø³ÙŠØ§Ø³ÙŠÙ‡ and Ø£Ø¨Ø¹Ø§Ø¯ Ø³ÙŠØ§Ø³ÙŠØ© for example.
I thought of making this using LIKE and wildcards.  but it won't work because I am comparing two strings not searching for a pattern of a one into the other so I though I can split the string into words and search for words as a pattern. but It seemed too complex and inaccurate.
another approach is to get all the records from the database and compare them to see how much they match up with my search text and if there was a one that highly matches I will get all the full row then. though I think it is very inefficient if the database got larger in size. I want to know if there is a little complex way to do it or if the query I mentioned above is fine.
